intro: Spigelia anthelmia var. nervosa, commonly known as the nerveleaf spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with prominent venation, which gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
